body.para: On Saturday 27 Sep 2003 22:21, Vojtech Pavlik wrote:

quote.quotepara: Yes, exactly so. We may have similar problems with differentiation elsewhere (touchpad vs 6dof device), so we'll probably need the 'class' field.

body.para: I don't know if this is relevant, but there are some devices which can work in either relative (like a touchpad) or absolute (like a touchscreen) mode. For example, using a combination of the kernel and the X drivers, at the moment I have my Wacom tablet working in relative mode when I'm using its mouse, but absolute mode when I'm using its pen.

I'm wondering whether we don't so much need a device class, as something to say whether the device works in absolute or relative mode, and that possibly we might have devices where this could be dynamically changed.
